API¶

The new constructor¶

camellia.new(key, mode=1, IV=None, **kwargs)¶

Create an “CamelliaCipher” object. It’s not fully PEP-272 comliant (yet). The default mode is ECB.

Parameters:
  • key (bytestring) – The key for encrytion/decryption. Must be 16/24/32 in length.
  • mode (int, on of MODE_* constants) – Mode of operation, only ECB (0) and CBC (1) are supported.
  • IV (bytestring) – Initialisation vector for CBC/CFB/OFB, must be 16 in length.
  • counter (callable, must return bytestrings) – Counter for CTR.
Returns:

CamelliaCipher
Raises:

ValueError, NotImplementedError

Modes of operation¶

camellia.MODE_ECB = 1¶

ECB mode of operation

camellia.MODE_CBC = 2¶

CBC mode of operation

camellia.MODE_CFB = 3¶

CFB mode of operation, currently not supported

camellia.MODE_OFB = 5¶

OFB mode of operation, currently not supported

camellia.MODE_CTR = 6¶

CTR mode of operation, currently not supported

The CamelliaCipher class¶

class camellia.CamelliaCipher(key, **kwargs)¶

The CamelliaCipher object.

__init__(key, **kwargs)¶

Constructer of Cipher class. See camellia.new().

mode and IV must be passed as keyword arguments.

block_size = 16¶

block size of the camellia cipher

decrypt(data)¶

Decrypt data.

Parameters:data (bytestring) – The data to decrypt. For the most modes of operation is must be a multiple of 16 in length.
encrypt(data)¶

Encrypt data.

Parameters:data (bytestring) – The data to encrypt. For the most modes of operation is must be a multiple of 16 in length.

Low-level camellia functions¶

camellia.Camellia_Ekeygen(rawKey)¶

Make a keytable from a key.

Parameters:rawKey (bytestring) – raw encryption key, 16, 24 or 32 bytes long
Returns:CFFI array
camellia.Camellia_Encrypt(keyLength, keytable, plainText)¶
camellia.Camellia_Decrypt(keyLength, keytable, cipherText)¶
